alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:22PM EDT until May 06 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR WESTERN MARTIN...SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON AND NORTHERN FLOYD COUNTIES... At 519 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wells Chapel, or 8 miles southwest of Inez, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Davisport around 525 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Debord and Inez. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
